values:
Turn me around, pick me up
Undo what I've become
Bring me back to the place
Of forgiveness and grace
I need You, need Your help
I can't do this myself
You're the only one who can undo
What I've become

Wish I had what I needed
To be on my own
Cause I feel so defeated
And I'm feeling alone.
And it all seems so helpless
And I have no plans
I'm a plane in the sunset
With nowhere to land

And all I see
It could never make me happy
And all my sandcastles spend their time collapsing

Let me know that you hear me
Let me know your touch
Let me know that you love me
Let that be enough

It's my birthday tomorrow
No one here could know
I was born this Thursday
Twenty-two years ago

And I feel stuck
Watching history repeating
Yeah, who am I
Just a kid who knows he's needy

 Let me know that you hear me
Let me know your touch
Let me know that you love me
Let that be enough

I take the kids to the library all the time for story hour, so I've gotten to know the children's librarian pretty well.  When I took Josh in today to look at books, she said to me, "I was just bragging about you this morning.   I said, 'She's a better parent than a lot of parents I know, and she isn't even a parent!'"

It's just so nice to hear things like that every once in awhile.

I loved HP7!  Not the best she's ever done, and there are still some things I have questions about.  But overall, I am very satisfied.  :D  And it only took me eight hours to read it!  lol...

And, I spent a fun weekend at my sister's house and attended the quietest party ever.  (Friday night-Saturday morning)   Ha!

Well... I had a rough evening of being very jealous (hung out with a friend and her new boyfriend). So on the way home I'm feeling all sorry for myself, and this song comes on the radio. God just loves to smack me upside the head with songs...


I have days where I hate my job
This little town and the whole world too
Last Sunday when the Steelers lost
Lord, it put me in a bad mood

I have moments when I curse the rain
Then complain when the sun's too hot
I look around at what everyone has
And I forget about all I've got

But I know I'm a lucky man
God's given me a pretty fair hand
Got a house and a piece of land
A few dollars in a coffee can
My old truck's still running good
My ticker's ticking like they say it should
I got supper in the oven, a good woman's loving
And one more day to be my little kid's dad
Lord knows I'm a lucky man

Got some friends who would be here fast
I could call 'em any time of day
Got a brother who's got my back
Got a mama who I swears a saint
Got a brand new rod and reel
Got a full week off this year
Dad had a close call last spring
It's a miracle he's still here

But I know I'm a lucky man
God's given me a pretty fair hand
Got a house and a piece of land
A few dollars in a coffee can
My old truck's still running good
My ticker's tickin' like they say it should
I got supper in the oven, a good woman's loving
And one more day to be my little kid's dad
Lord knows I'm a lucky man

My old truck's still running good
My ticker's ticking like they say it should
I got supper in the oven, a good woman's loving
And even my bad days ain't that bad
Yeah, I'm a lucky man
I'm a lucky lucky man



Not all of that is true, of course.... but really, the majority is.  Thanks for the smack, God....  or as Louisa said, "maybe it's more of a gentle  reminder than an outright smack?  either that or a divine 2x4."

Well, whatever it was... Thanks.

This birthday was soooo much better than last year.  Amazing what a difference great employers make.  :D

Nothing beats college birthdays, though.  ;)

You know you're doing something right when your kids are playing house and instead of one of them being the Mom, they pretend to be Kate.

:P

I miss him so much it hurts sometimes.

I miss talking about anything and everything for hours on end.

I miss late night Krispy Kreme runs.

I miss NJ.

I miss my Tuesday morning Bible Study.

I miss my guys in the band.

I miss my nanny friends and trips into the city.

I miss NJ Transit.

I miss standing on the shore and letting the wind blow all my cares away.

I miss my boys and their mischief.

I miss doing nothing at Sharon's house all day with my foster family.

I miss New York.




Why is it we are never happy where we are?

You Are Cookie Monster
Misunderstood as a primal monster, you're a true hedonist with a huge sweet tooth. You are usually feeling: Hungry. Cookies are preferred, but you'll eat anything if cookies aren't around. You are famous for: Your slightly crazy eyes and usual way of speaking How you live your life: In the moment. "Me want COOKIE!"
The Sesame Street Personality Quiz

I decided to go back to last year at this time and see what I wrote about the year to come.  Well, as it turns out, I was just looking back at the year that had passed.  I always seem to be doing that.  So in the same spirit, here's my 2006 in review (even though most of the year I would like to forget...).


In 2006 I...
[X] broke a promise
[] made a new best friend
[]fell in love
[] fell out of love
[X] did something you swore never to do
[X] lied
[] stole
[] went behind my parents back
[X] cried over a broken heart
[X] disappointed someone close
[X] hid a secret
[X] pretended to be happy
[] got arrested
[] kissed in the rain
[] slept under the stars
[] kept my new years resolution
[x]forgot my new years resolution
[X]met someone who changed my life
[]met one of my idols
[X]changed my outlook on life
[X]sat home all day doing nothing
[] pretended to be sick
[] left the country
[] almost died
[X] gave up something important to me
[X] lost something expensive
[X] learned something new about myself
[x] tried something I normally wouldn't try and liked it
[X] made a change in my life
[X] found out who your true friends were
[X] made a total fool of myself
[X] met great people
[] snuck out of the house
[] stayed up til sunrise
[X] pigged out over the summer
[] met someone from myspace in person
[X] cried over the silliest thing
[X] was never home on weekends (first half of the year, anyway)
[] got into a car accident
[X] found a person i never thought i'd become real good friends with
[X] had friends who were drifting away from me
[] had someone close to me die
[] was in a relationship
[X] became wiser
[] had a high cell phone bill
[] wasted most of my money on food
[] had a fist fight
[] went to the beach
[X] saw a celebrity
[X] got sick
[] liked more than 5 people at the same time
[X] became closer to a lot of people

I'm so tired of being here
Suppressed by all my childish fears
And if you have to leave
I wish that you would just leave
Cause your presence still lingers here
And it won't leave me alone

These wounds won't seem to heal
This pain is just too real
There's just too much that time cannot erase

When you cried I'd wipe away all of your tears
When you'd scream I'd fight away all of your fears
And I held your hand through all of these years
But you still have
All of me

You used to captivate me
By your resonating life
Now I'm bound by the life you've left behind
Your face it haunts
My once pleasant dreams
Your voice it chased away
All the sanity in me

I've tried so hard to tell myself that you're gone
But though you're still with me
I've been alone all along

When you cried I'd wipe away all of your tears
When you'd scream I'd fight away all of your fears
And I held your hand through all of these years
But you still have
All of me




Why can't I get over this? It's been more than two years! : /

AAAAHHHHHHH!!!!  I'm leaving tomorrow....  NJ to drop off my car at a friend's house, then taking the train into NYC.  Staying at a hotel in Brooklyn Friday night, then Saturday walking all day!! 26.3 miles, hopefully.  Saturday night camping out in a tent on Randall's Island.  Sunday getting up and walking 13.1 more miles!  Oh man!  I'm so excited/nervous/happy/anxious/etc!

:D

"Of course as we know the meaning of jihad can only be understood by Muslims," Budianto (a protest organizer) told the crowd. "Only Muslims can understand what jihad is. It is impossible that jihad can be linked with violence, we Muslims have no violent character."

And yet, they are burning effigies of the Pope, and two churches in the West Bank were firebombed.  And they're calling the Pope hypocritical.

Does anyone else see anything wrong here???





Meredith, I promise a real update soon.  :P

Two confessions:

I am getting addicted to kids' shows.

I have a crush on Sportacus.



:P

Yeah I guess it is about time for an update.   Soooo..... the job is great.  I'm really loving it!  Josh is so cute though he cries a lot (he's only two).  Isabella is really fun though she can be pretty bossy.  We're working on that.  Their apartment complex has a pool, so we've been there almost every day.  The lifeguard has caught on that you have to coax Josh to get in, so he comes over and encourages him to jump, counting down and everything.  Occasionally he'll actually jump in with Josh.  It's great.  That's about the only way I can get Josh in the pool, even though he's a pretty good swimmer with his floaties on.  Isabella always wants to play house or dolls, and that's not my favorite thing.  I feel bad but I don't play with her very often.  I'd rather sit and color or play hide and seek or something like that than play pretend.  But yeah, I am enjoying my job.  It is a lot of work, and I'm still relying on the TV a little too much (but there's not much we can do outside where they live, and it's been too hot to stay out long).  The parents are great too.  They're so easygoing and nice, and they always act surprised when I do stuff around the house like finishing the laundry that they started, or vacuuming (as opposed to pointing out what I missed or did wrong....).

Being at home is great.  I finally got my room all set up, and my mom bought me a TV and cable for back in my room.  Plus we have wireless internet, so I'm great to just stay back in my room!  I've been trying to go for walks to train for the Avon Walk, but it has been so darn hot that I haven't been out much in the last couple weeks.  Last night I was out for almost two hours, and I hurt my foot somehow.  It's had a bruise on it for a few days, and all the walking I did made something inside the foot under the bruise hurt.  I don't know what I did, the shoes weren't too tight or anything.  But it's frustrating cuz it still hurts so I can't walk for a few days.  :(

Speaking of, all you faithful followers of my livejournal (all what, like two of you?).... I still need more money for the Avon Walk!  If eight more people would give $100, I would meet my requirement!  I know that's a lot of money.  So if sixteen people would give just $50, I'd be there!  Please help me out.  There are only two months left!  The link for my page is www.tinyurl.com/mver4.  That takes you right to my own Avon Walk website where you can read about my journey and donate online.  If you want to send cash or check, send it to me!  Let me know if you need my address.  I really need the help.

And in other news...  well there really isn't other news.  My life is basically my job now.  I don't usually get home till 6:30 or so.  I've still been teaching the twenties Sunday School class, when anybody shows up, which is like every other week.  Today was the church picnic and for some reason there weren't any teachers for the Jr and Sr High classes, so I taught those too!  It wasn't very great.  Of course nobody wanted to sit there and listen to me yapping.  So I taught for a little bit then we went for a hike.  It was a fun picnic, though I wish Ariane had let little Ben come.

Oh and I'm soooo excited for Labor Day because I have a four-day weekend, and I'm going camping with Jeannine!  We're going to Deep Creek Lake, MD, which is in the very western part of MD.  She's going to see if she can get her parents' kayaks too.  That would be great!!!  But even if she can't, it'll still be awesome.  I can't wait!

So there ya go, Meredith, there's your update.  :P  Hope everyone else is having a great summer!  Donate to my walk!!!  ;)

Yay!!!   I will be taking care of two kids, a girl age 4 and a boy age 2.   Lots of work!!  It'll be hard for awhile, I know.  But they are soooo adorable.  For the first few months they will be living in Robinson, so it'll be a half hour commute everyday.  Yuck.  But, by the end of October, they will be moving to Brighton Township, so it'll be less than ten minutes away!  Wahoo!  The parents seem very nice, I had lunch with the dad yesterday.  And the kids sound very well behaved (I know, they all do at first).  I'm so excited!  :D

Grand total:  65 Disney Movies!

AAAHHH!!!!!  I'm done!!!!


Still not sinking in that I'm moving out tomorrow....

Yes, I've started the countdown.  I kind of felt guilty starting it before, but now, I'm done.  There are so many feelings associated with moving.  I'm so sad to leave this place behind (no, it's really true).  I've made some great friends, got involved in an amazing church, was blessed to be part of the Hanover Wind Symphony...  I'm really gonna miss NYC, the mountains, and the shore.  I won't miss the crazy drivers or the ridiculousness of keeping up with everybody else in town who's richer than you.  But despite my insistence that I hate NJ, I really will miss this place.  

But, I'm soooo excited to go back home.  I still feel like a loser moving back in with my parents, but I dont' really care.  Some of my good friends still live at home.  It's not like I'll be totally mooching.  Once I get settled and find a good job, I plan to pay rent.  At least a little bit...  I'm soooo excited to see my family, and hug my nephew, and walk through the woods behind my house, and have my old room back, and just be HOME again!!!

Feels like just yesterday, I had these big dreams of moving to a new place and finding myself, being someone new and better, having a great adventure.  And you know what?  I really have.  It's just weird that it only lasted two years and now it's over.... it's like life, fast forwarded.  I guess that's the cool thing about my job.  I get to start over completely every year or two.  

Well, here's to the next big adventure!!
So.... five weeks from today, I will be moving.  Yikes.
Wow.  When it rains, it pours.  Unbelievable.

So tomorrow's my birthday.  I have nothing planned at all.  We don't have Bible Study because this session ended last week.  I got a couple cards from family.  When I was home over Easter, we had my birthday dinner, but I just got my favorite cake and the dinner I  picked (from three choices).  No candles, no singing, no presents.  Penny's supposedly getting a cake for me at her pool party this weekend, but I don't know if that will really happen.  

Gosh I sound like a whiny brat.  It's just, this is the one day a year that's for me, you know?  I don't need much.  But SOMEthing!

Last year Jeannine came and stayed overnight with me.  Before that was college and birthdays were always a blast at college.  Surprise parties and kidnappings, signs and balloons outside my door.

Now I got nothin.

And it sucks.  And life sucks.  And I wanna go home.

Because being at home makes me feel nostalgic...

Your senior year in High School is supposed to be "the best year of your life." Let's see how much you remember. I know for some it might be hard for you to go back that far!

Year: 2000

1. Who was your best friend?
Lauren Jarrell and Greg Steele

2. What sports did you play?
none

3. What kind of car did you drive?
none.... my mom's minivan when needed :P

4. It's Friday night, where were you?
in the fall, marching at a football game... other times, maybe the movies or Lauren's house

5. Were you a party animal?
haha 

6. Were you in the "In Crowd"?
umm no.  i was in the band crowd

7. Ever skip school?
I think just on senior skip day...

8. Ever smoke?
nope

9. Were you a nerd?
yeah. just a little bit.

10. Did you get suspended/expelled?
nope

11. Can you sing the alma mater?
no, but I could play it!

12. Who was your favorite teacher?
Umm I don't know... Mr. McKinney probably (what a hottie :P)

13. Favorite class?
Band... are we seeing a pattern here?  After that, maybe German.

14. What was your schools full name?
Beaver Area High School

15. School mascot?
Bobcat

16. Did you go to Prom?
Yep, with Greg

17. If you could go back and do it over, would you?
Definitely not.  Had some good times, but would never want to go through all that again.

18. What do you remember most about graduation?
Being really sad and thinking how I might never see most of these people again

19. Favorite memory of your Senior Year?
Just being a senior in band... it has its perks.

20. Were you ever posted up on the senior wall?
I don't even know what that is...

21. Did you have a job your senior year?
Nope, not till after graduation.  Then I worked at Sheetz.

22. Who did you date?
Nobody

23. Where did you go most often for lunch?
Umm the cafeteria?  We weren't allowed to go to the band room anymore.

24. Have you gained weight since then?
yeah.... way too much stress

25. What did you do after graduation?
Had some parties and just spent lots of time with my friends


Ahhh high school.   Funny how I don't speak to anyone from high school anymore.  At all.  Unless you count Greg.  But I don't count him because we went to college together too so he moved into the college friends category.  :P

K.  That was all.  I'll actually update this in a few days probably.  :P

Your Five Factor Personality Profile
Extroversion: You have low extroversion. You are quiet and reserved in most social situations. A low key, laid back lifestyle is important to you. You tend to bond slowly, over time, with one or two people. Conscientiousness: You have medium conscientiousness. You're generally good at balancing work and play. When you need to buckle down, you can usually get tasks done. But you've been known to goof off when you know you can get away with it. Agreeableness: You have high agreeableness. You are easy to get along with, and you value harmony highly. Helpful and generous, you are willing to compromise with almost anyone. You give people the benefit of the doubt and don't mind giving someone a second chance. Neuroticism: You have medium neuroticism. You're generally cool and collected, but sometimes you do panic. Little worries or problems can consume you, draining your energy. Your life is pretty smooth, but there's a few emotional bumps you'd like to get rid of. Openness to experience: Your openness to new experiences is low. You're a pretty conservative person, and you favor what's socially acceptable. You think that change for novelty's sake is a very bad idea. While some may see this as boring, many see you as dependable and wise.
The Five Factor Personality Test

I haven't really updated in, um, forever... so here's a few tidbits just to satisfy your curiosity (cuz I know you've been dying to know).  This weekend I hung out with Sharon all day on Saturday.  It's just so nice to have someone you can spend ten hours with and not run out of things to say.  I am so thankful for a friend like that.  Sunday I went out to dinner with a few nanny friends.  We went to the Black Horse in Mendham, which is always excellent.

Last weekend I had to work, since both parents are doing monthly National Guard drills again.  Blah.

Work.  Well, don't get me started.  I'm very frustrated and ready to be done.  Some people are just hard to work with/for.

Band is great.  We're working on some new stuff on our website (okay, the webmaster and director are... not me, per se).  They want to put up some professional photos we took at our last concert, as well as some sound recordings.   They will also be taking individual photos of us this week and putting those up with a bio of each of us.  So check me out sometime soon. ;)   www.hanoverwinds.org.  They do all this cool stuff right when I'm getting ready to leave.  :(

Last week I played my euphonium at church with a bunch of other musicians.  We are doing 40 Days of Purpose during Lent, so we had a big kickoff service with all three services combined into one.  It was a lot of fun playing, we had some great music.  Fast upbeat stuff as well as old hymns and great praise tunes.  There was a big screen that they were broadcasting it on, and apparently I was on there a couple times.  So many people came up to me later and said they saw me, and they didn't know I played an instrument, and what was that thing anyway?  Haha....  Good times.

I think I need new glasses.  My eye has been twitching for over a month (off and on, not constantly), and I thought it was from lack of sleep or being stressed, but now I'm beginning to think it's my eyesight going bad in that eye.  The twitching stops when I take off my glasses (although then I get a headache from trying to focus my eyes).  And I don't have vision insurance, so there goes my next paycheck, at least.

Guess that's it for now.  I'm just counting the days till the end of summer.  :/

So I have to share my latest purchase cuz I'm sooo excited about it.  I'm in this program called MyPoints, which is free and gives you points for just clicking on emails, or for ordering stuff from all kinds of sites through their site.  I also have their credit card, which is where I get a lot of my points.  And when you get a certain number of points, you can get a free gift card!  I always order a Barnes and Noble gift card, cuz I love books, and it's a special treat since it's free.  Free books!  So far in the past few years that I've been in the program, I've redeemed gift cards for about $150, all at Barnes and Noble.  Do you know how many books that is?? I just found out they also carry Panera gift cards so I may get that next time...  Anyway.  I just ordered the set of three Christy movies (the new ones) from Barnes and Noble and only had to pay $6 for them after my $25 gift card.  How exciting is that?   So if I get my friends to sign up and earn some points, I get extra points.... and you get gift cards for free.  ;)   If you want in on the action, let me know!

the Romantic
Test finished!
you chose BY - your Enneagram type is FOUR.

"I am unique"

Romantics have sensitive feelings and are warm and perceptive.

How to Get Along with Me

  • Give me plenty of compliments. They mean a lot to me.
  • Be a supportive friend or partner. Help me to learn to love and value myself.
  • Respect me for my special gifts of intuition and vision.
  • Though I don't always want to be cheered up when I'm feeling melancholy, I sometimes like to have someone lighten me up a little.
  • Don't tell me I'm too sensitive or that I'm overreacting!

What I Like About Being a Four

  • my ability to find meaning in life and to experience feeling at a deep level
  • my ability to establish warm connections with people
  • admiring what is noble, truthful, and beautiful in life
  • my creativity, intuition, and sense of humor
  • being unique and being seen as unique by others
  • having aesthetic sensibilities
  • being able to easily pick up the feelings of people around me

What's Hard About Being a Four

  • experiencing dark moods of emptiness and despair
  • feelings of self-hatred and shame; believing I don't deserve to be loved
  • feeling guilty when I disappoint people
  • feeling hurt or attacked when someone misundertands me
  • expecting too much from myself and life
  • fearing being abandoned
  • obsessing over resentments
  • longing for what I don't have

Fours as Children Often

  • have active imaginations: play creatively alone or organize playmates in original game s
  • are very sensitive
  • feel that they don't fit in
  • believe they are missing something that other people have
  • attach themselves to idealized teachers, heroes, artists, etc.
  • become antiauthoritarian or rebellious when criticized or not understood
  • feel lonely or abandoned (perhaps as a result of a death or their parents' divorce)

Fours as Parents

  • help their children become who they really are
  • support their children's creativity and originality
  • are good at helping their children get in touch with their feelings
  • are sometimes overly critical or overly protective
  • are usually very good with children if not too self-absorbed

Renee Baron & Elizabeth Wagele

The Enneagram Made Easy
Discover the 9 Types of People
HarperSanFrancisco, 1994, 161 pages

AAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!









Okay I feel better now.

Okay I have been wanting to write about this for awhile now. But now I really have to say something. These Muslim riots are just ridiculous. I will say that to disrespect someone's religion like that is wrong. They shouldn't have made those cartoons in the first place. I'm not condoning or encouraging making fun of others' beliefs. However, the way that many Muslims are taking this is even worse! It's just reprehensible that they are out there killing people and destroying property just because they are offended. That's ridiculous. I've read a few different articles about this, and I really like this one.  "Freedom means learning to deal with being offended."   Yes!

For example, Christians are ridiculed often in our society.  Take TV.  Recently, NBC started to run a sitcom called The Book of Daniel, which obviously was pointing fun at Christians and essentially labeling them as hypocrites.  I'm not denying that there are hypocrites in the Christian religion, but don't lump us all together.  Anyway.  That was very offensive to anyone who could honestly call themselves a Christian.  But were Christians burning NBC's studios?  Were they putting out hits on NBC execs and writers?  Bombing TV stations who played the show?  NO!  We sent out petitions, wrote letters to TV stations and to NBC, and boycotted the show.  And guess what?  The show is no longer on.  Nobody was watching it. 

Today I read this one.  Italy's Prime Minister called himself the "Christ of politics."  You know what?  That offends me greatly.  How dare anyone call himself Christ?  That's horrible, it's blasphemous, and makes me cringe.  But I'm not going to go try and kill him.  Firstly because it goes against my beliefs and is just wrong (imagine that).  But secondly because it's called free speech!  He's allowed to say it.  I'm allowed to be offended. 

Freedom means learning to deal with being offended.  Deal with it, without resorting to violence and destroying other people's property and lives.
EDIT: I've done a little more research, and I guess I didn't really know what was in the cartoons before. But I believe they weren't written to make fun of Muslims; rather, they were political cartoons pointing out injustices in the Muslim world. I will condone that, as it is true. So scratch that part about the cartoons shouldn't have been written. They should have. The truth is hard to deal with sometimes. EDIT 2: Here's another perfect example. The recent Rolling Stone magazine with Kanye West on the cover portrayed as Jesus Christ. Excuse me? That disgusted me, to say the least. Absolutely horrendously wrong. How dare they? How dare he? Extremely offensive. Worth killing people over? Absolutely not. As one of CNN's bloggers pointed out, in our culture, we value human life. How about they respect OUR values for once since they insist we respect theirs?

29. The world could do without: terrorists who think blowing up buildings, other people, and themselves will solve anything (especially when they do it in the name of religion)

So tonight at band I was discussing with cute stand partner the fact that the other two members of our section have had babies recently. (Well, Dan's baby is due next week... Matt's was in the fall.)  So Mike said, "Man, I'm feeling left out."  Then I said, "Yeah, Mike, we better get started."  hehehe...  Then he got all red (I think I embarrassed him... he wouldn't even look at me) and said, "Whoa!  Not so shy over there, are you?"  I was thinking about saying, "I didn't mean it like that!!!"..... but I did...... So I said, "Take it however you want to!"   lol

Oh if he only knew what goes on in my head....

0:)

Dear God,

This wasn't exactly what I meant when I asked You to help me eat less...
Steelers are in the Super Bowl!  Steelers are in the Super Bowl!!!!

Well not much is new.  Except that weather this week, man that was weird.  Saturday night we lost power for awhile because the wind had knocked some trees over, cutting power lines.  Too much rain and wind!  There are trees down all over the place.  I really haven't seen that many trees down ever.  It looked like a hurricane went through.  Some people were without power for days.  It happened again overnight Tuesday.  The boys didn't have school on Wednesday because the school had no power.  Woo that was a fun day.  Crazy kids.  Crazy weather!  And today it was sunny and almost 60!  So weird.  I'll take this weather though, it's perfect.  I think it was only for today though...

Tomorrow I'm going bowling with Nanny Alliance.  And Sunday is a Steelers party at Bethany's for the NJ Nannies.  Yay!  I am sooo excited for the Steelers game.  Kick some butt, guys!  And Sharon is coming with me, yay! She finally gets to meet my nanny friends!

Umm what else....  Oh band.  Of course. :)  Band is my refuge.  I love it sooo much.  I feel like I'm such a dork, but I don't care.  I can't even explain it, really.  It's just the one place I know I belong.  I feel so comfortable sitting there in my section, my euphonium on my lap.  I know my place, you know?  And I just love making music.  It's such an amazing feeling.  I'm going to be soooo sad to leave this band.  :(  But, oh yeah.  We're making a professional recording!!  Like, one that will be sold on Amazon.com, you know?  We do a CD every year from one of the concerts, but just sell it to the members of the band (yes I have both of them from the years I was in it).  This one will be professionally recorded (our director knows someone) at our May concert, which we're doing with Paul Cohen, a great saxophone guy (yeah, I know, saxophone.  blech.).  Hehe...  But... so cool.  I'm going to be on Amazon!  Look for me later this year.... :p

I'm watching Princess Diaries 2.  I just love this movie.  It is sooo much better than the first.  The guy who plays Nicholas, mmmm.  I love him!  Just thought I'd share.

Okay I guess that's about it.  I'm rambling about nothing now.  Thanks for reading.  :p

I got proposed to tonight.  ;)

By a five year old named James.  He even kissed me (on the cheek).


But then he broke our engagement.  There was another woman.  He decided he really wants to marry his mom.

Sigh.  Another one bites the dust.

So.... not a whole lot of stuff going on.  Last night was our first band rehearsal since the beginning of December, and it made me very happy.  :)  Trombone player- no go.  I don't know why he keeps catching my eye, but other than that first time we talked, he hasn't been overly nice to me ever. Actually he's seemed like kind of a jerk whenever I try to talk to him.  So, I guess he was just being nice and giving me a compliment on my playing that one night.  I'll take it.  And stop overanalyzing.  :p  (And start daydreaming about cute stand partner once again.... lol)

Andy asked me if I was planning on leaving when Lea got back (February) so I said no.  He said good, that they really want me to stay at least through the summer.  So I told him I wasn't sure when I wanted to leave, but maybe at the end of the summer.  So there.  That's out there now, even if it's just a big maybe.  I guess the big talk can wait awhile now, since the end of the summer is still about eight months away. (I need to give at least six weeks' notice according to my contract.)

Oh!  Christmas!  Okay... well I did a whole lot of shopping... that was pretty much it.  I got to see Meredith (twice!  I ran into her at the Grove City outlets, and then had lunch with her the next day).  And one night I went to Greg and Amber's along with Heather and we played Scene It Movie edition, which was sooo much fun.  I won the first game :p and Greg won the second.  Cody didn't come... I never emailed (okay I'm a jerk) and he never called Greg back after Greg left him a message (apparently he's never home?).  I don't know what my problem is.  I keep making this way more complicated than it needs to be.  Sigh...

And I got a new computer last month.  Yay!  As my dad said, Dude, I got a Dell.  Haha, yes he did say that.  Oh, more of Christmas!  Sorry, sidetracked too easily...   I got some way cool stuff, including a beautiful amethyst necklace, a thistle necklace, a really nice Eeyore watch, a nature sounds cd/radio/alarm clock (wahoo!), a paint by number kit, a pooh and eeyore rug (which claudius has taken over), a couple Eeyore bean bag animals that I collect, a couple bells which I also collect, a couple shirts, a picture of my sis and I at Central Park, a book called 14,000 Things to Make You Happy (or something like that.... I'll have to start writing some of those in here.  They're great), (checks box still sitting on my floor....), and The Procrastinator's Planner for 2006 from Jeannine.  Does she know me or what?  Haha... I should really start using that... Maybe tomorrow.

Hahahahaha did you get that?  I crack myself up.

Don't you love it when I update when I'm tired and giddy?

All right I'm going to stop now and go to bed.  So much for getting there early.  :/
